question: Quality control agent for Sterilization in Autoclave
exp: Autoclaving Geobacillus stearothermophilus(GBS) Hydroclaving Bacillus subtilis Microwaving Bacillus atrophaeus Dry heat GBS or Bacillus atrophaeus

question: Radius of Inner circle in the Logo given below is:-
exp: Logo given question is of Radiation Hazard:- Central circles of radius R, an internal radius of 1. 5R and an external radius of 5R for the blades, which are separated from each other by 60 degree. Trefoil is black in the international version. Commonly referred to as a Radioactivity warning sign, but it is actually a warning sign of ionizing radiation. Includes X-ray apparatus, medical beam cannons and paicle accelerators.

question: Most satisfactory method of refuse disposal is:
exp: Refuse disposal: Sanitary landfill (Controlled tipping) laying of dry & condensed refuse in layers with inveing eah paitions & covering, followed by mechanical compression (most satisfactory method when suitable land is available). Trench method Ramp method Area method

question: Disposal of Glass vaccine ls as Biomedical wastes is done by:-
exp: Disposal of glass vaccine ls and metallic body implants as biomedical wastes: Blue category. Treatment and disposal is done by Chemical treatment/autoclaving / Hydroclaving / Microwaving followed by Recycling.

question: Temperature for Plasma Pyrolysis:-
exp: Temperatures: - Dry Heat - > 185deg C - Plasma Pyrolysis - > 1200 deg C - Autoclaving - In India = 121deg C - Hydroclaving - 121 deg C/ 132deg C - Incineration - > 1200 deg C

question: Container used for disposal of Human anatomical waste materials is:
All of the following are the Sporicidal agents among the following except -
exp: Ethyl and isopropyl alcohol are potent bactericidal, fungicidal, virucidal and tuberculocidal, but does not destroy bacterialspores. Chlorine and chlorine compounds: They are potent bactericidal, fungicidal, sporicidal, tuberculocidal and virucidal. Iodine is bactericidal, fungicidal, virucidal and lethal to spore-bearing organisms. Hydrogen peroxide is bactericidal, virucidal, sporicidal and fungicidal. Ethylene oxide which kills bacteria, spores and viruses.

question: Chemical waste disposal under Biomedical waste management guidelines is:
exp: - Chemical BMW waste disposal is in yellow category: done by Incineration, Plasma pyrolysis, Encapsulation - Also remember, dead fetus below the age of bility is considered as human anatomical waste & should be disposed through yellow bag, by deep burial. - Radiological waste covered under Atomic energy act 1962, doesn't come under biomedical waste

question: 'Savlon' contains:
exp: Savlon: Chlorhexidine (Hibitane) 0. 3% and Cetrimide (Cetavlon) 3% Chlorhexidine is effective against a wide range of Gram-negative and Gram-positive vegetative bacteria, yeasts, dermatophyte fungi and lipophilic viruses It is inactive against bacterial spores, except at elevated temperatures

question: All are Incinerated except:-
exp: - Broken thermometers contain Mercury, its disposal is through recycling. INCINERATION: Temperature = > 1200oC. Principle = High temperature + Dry oxidation. Has Combustible matter > 60%; Non-combustible solids < 0. 5%; Non-combustible fines < 20% and moisture content <30%. Human anatomical wastes, animal wastes, solid waste, chemical waste/ discarded medicines etc. can be incinerated. Contraindications: PVC plastic waste. Pressurized waste. Heavy metal waste. Reactive chemical waste. Radio-active waste - sea burial is recommended.

question: Which of the following agents are used to check sufficiency of a. Autoclaving b. Hydroclaving c. Microwaving
exp: Thermal methods Principle Agent used to check its sufficiency 1. Autoclaving - Steam under high temperature - Temperature used in India = 121oC, >45 min; 15 psi Geobacillus stearothermophilus 2. Hydroclaving - Steam under pressure - Temperature used = 121oC or 132oC Bacillus subtilis 3. Microwaving - Generation of convention current in heated water molecules - Frequency of 2450 MHz & wave length of 12. 24 nm is used. Bacillus atrophaeus
opa: a - Bacillus atrophaeus, b - Bacillus subtilis, c - Geobacillus stearothermophilus
opb: a - Bacillus subtilis, b - Bacillus atrophaeus, c - Geobacillus stearothermophilus
opc: a - Geobacillus stearothermophilus, b - Bacillus subtilis, c - Bacillus atrophaeus
opd: a - Bacillus atrophaeus, b - Geobacillus stearothermophilus, c - Bacillus subtilis

question: Which of the following is not a Halogenated disinfectant?
exp: Savlon is a Quaternary ammonium compound, combination of cetavlon and hibitane. Halogenated compounds: Bleaching powder Iodophores Hypochlorites

question: Biomedical waste mixing with Cement is known as:
exp: Ineization: Process: Mixing biomedical waste with cement and other substance before disposal, so as to minimize risk of toxic substances contained in waste to contaminate ground / surface water. Ineization is especially suitable for pharmaceuticals and for incineration ashes with high metal content. EXTRA EDGE: - Hepatitis-B & Tetanus vaccines are recommended in health care workers handling biomedical waste. - Health check-up should be done yearly for these workers & booster doses are given if required.

question: Incineration is?
exp: High temperature oxidation process INCINERATION 1. Incineration: Is a 'high temperature dry oxidation' process; It leads to Significant reduction in waste- volume and weight (up to 70 - 80%) 2. Incineration does not require pre-treatment 3. Biggest disadvantage of incineration: Generation of smoke 4. Types of Incinerators: - Double-chamber pyrolytic - Single-chamber pyrolytic - Rotary kilns 5. Temperature in an incinerator: - Primary chamber: 800deg +- 50degC - Secondary chamber: 1050deg +- 50degC

question: Expired medicines must be put in ____colored biomedical waste management bag:-
exp: Expired medicines must be put in yellow colored biomedical waste management bag. Treatment and disposal is done by; Incineration/ plasma pyrolysis/ encapsulation. Dry Heat - Temp > 185deg C. Plasma Pyrolysis - > 1200 deg C. Extra edge: - No healthcare system would establish on-site treatment & disposal facility if a Common Biomedical Treatment facility is available within 75kms.
